body: I've tested it, and it is not quick enough (a few minutes for one day worth of pushes), so the caching of push results is still required. There is possibly some other thing in mozci to cache in order to make this possible (we can check by using a profiler).
I've profiled a script to analyze a push where AD data is cached, and as we could expect most of the time is spent in talking with hgmo.

issue.title: Get bugs fixed by changesets directly from the ActiveData repo table

repository.name: mozci
repository.description: A library for inspecting push and task results in Mozilla's CI

issue.body:
Currently we hit hgmo to get this info.

Depends on https://github.com/mozilla/ActiveData/issues/196.

issue.title: Retrieve backedout information from ActiveData instead of HGMO

repository.name: mozci
repository.description: A library for inspecting push and task results in Mozilla's CI

issue.title: Use a lock to ensure we only run one ActiveData query at a time
issue.body:
I'd need to run mozci in multiple threads for https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/issues/1449, to load elements from the cache in parallel, but I don't want to overwhelm ActiveData.
Since we know ActiveData can't handle too many clients, I think we can just add a lock in adr directly so all clients have the same limitation.
